> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On 

> If all =
your testMethods() use the same environment (the same 
> setup), you can re=
move duplication by moving the common set 
> up code into setUp().

Sure, b=
ut what if this set up should only be run once for the entire class?
(which=
 was Allen's original question if I'm not mistaken)

For example, imagine t=
hat the class to test does some verification on an XML
file.  In this case,=
 the one-time set up should simply parse the XML file,
create the DOM tree =
and then use the class to perform various verifications
on this tree.  And =
of course, we don't want to re-parse it every time.

> > yet I'm finding to=
ns of places
> > where I need a one time setup and teardown for the whole T=
estCase.
> 
> Are your tests really independent from each other?

I can com=
e up with a lot of examples where such a fine grained (or coarse
grained, i=
n this case) setUp/tearDown life cycle is necessary without the
tests being=
 dependent on each other.
